segment.source: Migrate User Accounts (Windows 10)
segment.target: Migrate User Accounts (Windows 10)

segment.source: Migrate User Accounts
segment.target: Migrate User Accounts

segment.source: Migrate User Accounts
segment.target: Migrate User Accounts

segment.source: By default, all users are migrated.
segment.target: By default, all users are migrated.

segment.source: The only way to specify which users to include and exclude is on the command line by using the User options.
segment.target: The only way to specify which users to include and exclude is on the command line by using the User options.

segment.source: You cannot specify users in the migration XML files or by using the Config.xml file.
segment.target: You cannot specify users in the migration XML files or by using the Config.xml file.

segment.source: In this Topic
segment.target: In this Topic

segment.target: To migrate all user accounts and user settings

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You do not have to specify the /lae option, which enables the account that was created with the /lac option.
segment.target: You do not have to specify the /lae option, which enables the account that was created with the /lac option.

segment.source: Instead, you can create a disabled local account by specifying only the /lac option, and then a local administrator needs to enable the account on the destination computer.
segment.target: Instead, you can create a disabled local account by specifying only the /lac option, and then a local administrator needs to enable the account on the destination computer.
